00013 // a jdataview has columns

00015 // constants
00016 
00017 #define JCOLUMN_DEFAULT_WIDTH 50
00018 #define JCOLUMN_DEFAULT_MINWIDTH 50
00019 #define JCOLUMN_DEFAULT_MAXWIDTH 100
00020 
00021 #define JCOLUMN_DEFAULT_FONTSIZE 10
00022 
00023 #define JCOLUMN_DEFAULT_MAXTEXTLEN 256
00024 
00025 // values for c_alignment
00026 
00027 enum {
00028     JCOLUMN_ALIGN_LEFT = 1,
00029     JCOLUMN_ALIGN_CENTER,
00030     JCOLUMN_ALIGN_RIGHT
00031 };
00032 
00033 enum {
00034     JCOLUMN_STYLE_PLAIN = 0,
00035     JCOLUMN_STYLE_BOLD = 1,
00036     JCOLUMN_STYLE_ITALIC = 2
00037 };
00038 
00039 enum {
00040     JCOLUMN_MOUSE_ENTER = 0,
00041     JCOLUMN_MOUSE_MOVE = 1,
00042     JCOLUMN_MOUSE_EXIT = 2
00043 };
00044 
00045 enum {
00046     JCOLUMN_SORTDIRECTION_FORWARD = 1,
00047     JCOLUMN_SORTDIRECTION_BACKWARD = 0
00048 };
00049 
00050 enum {
00051     JCOLUMN_INITIALLYSORTED_NONE = 0,
00052     JCOLUMN_INITIALLYSORTED_FORWARDS = 1,
00053     JCOLUMN_INITIALLYSORTED_BACKWARDS = 2
00054 };
00055 
00056 // kinds of JUCE component style columns (or cells within columns)
00057 
00058 enum {
00059     JCOLUMN_COMPONENT_NONE = 0,
00060     JCOLUMN_COMPONENT_CHECKBOX = 1,
00061     JCOLUMN_COMPONENT_TEXTEDITOR = 2,       // eventually alphanumeric and numeric variants
00062     JCOLUMN_COMPONENT_SLIDER = 3,
00063     JCOLUMN_COMPONENT_COLOR = 4,
00064     JCOLUMN_COMPONENT_MENU = 5
00065 };
00066 
00067 enum {
00068     JCOLUMN_MENU_INDEX = 1,                 // report index chosen instead of value of item
00069     JCOLUMN_MENU_FONTMENU = 2,              // flag for showing a font menu
00070     JCOLUMN_MENU_PAINT = 4,                 // cell is drawn with client paint method
00071     JCOLUMN_MENU_SELECT = 8,                    // row is selected on mouse down
00072     JCOLUMN_MENU_NOPANEL = 16,              // for font menu, don't include the show fonts item
00073     JCOLUMN_MENU_CLEARITEM = 32             // for font menu, include a clear item
00074 };
00075 
00076 enum {
00077     JCOLUMN_TEXT_ONESYMBOL = 1,
00078     JCOLUMN_TEXT_COMMASEPARATED = 2,
00079     JCOLUMN_TEXT_ICON = 4,
00080     JCOLUMN_TEXT_HASBUTTON = 8,
00081     JCOLUMN_TEXT_FILECHOOSEBUTTON = 16,
00082     JCOLUMN_TEXT_VIEWBUTTON = 32,
00083     JCOLUMN_TEXT_EDITBUTTON = 64,
00084     JCOLUMN_TEXT_TIME = 128,
00085     JCOLUMN_TEXT_FLOAT = 256,
00086     JCOLUMN_TEXT_INT = 512,
00087     JCOLUMN_TEXT_CANTEDIT = 1024,
00088     JCOLUMN_TEXT_FONTSIZE = 2048
00089 };
00090 
00091 enum {
00092     JCOLUMN_SLIDER_NOTEXTBOX = 1,
00093     JCOLUMN_SLIDER_ZERO_TO_ONE = 2
00094 };

00096 #define JCOLUMN_DISABLED 0x1000
00097 
00098 typedef struct _celldesc
00099 {
00100     long row;
00101     long col;
00102     long data;
00103 } t_celldesc;
00104 
00105 typedef struct _col
00106 {
00107     t_object c_obj;
00108     void *obex;
00109     t_symbol *c_name;           // column name (hash)
00110     t_object *c_dv;             // parent dataview
00111     int c_id;                   // id in DataViewComponent
00112     long c_width;               // column width in pixels
00113     long c_maxwidth;            // max column width
00114     long c_minwidth;            // min column width
00115     char c_autosize;            // determine width of text column automatically (true/false)
00116     char c_alignment;           // display of text, left, right, center
00117     t_symbol *c_font;           // name of font
00118     long c_fontsize;            // font size (points?)
00119     t_symbol *c_label;          // heading of column
00120     char c_separator;           // separator mode
00121     char c_button;              // column has a button (true/false)
00122     t_symbol *c_buttonlabel;    // text in a button
00123     t_symbol *c_customsort;     // message sent to sort this column -- if none, default sorting is used based on value c_numeric
00124     char c_overridesort;        // if true only the sortdata method is called, not the sort method (true/false)
00125     t_symbol *c_custompaint;    // send this msg name to client to paint this column
00126     t_symbol *c_valuemsg;       // message sent when a component mode cell's value changes
00127     t_symbol *c_beginmsg;       // message sent when a component mode cell's value is about to start changing
00128     t_symbol *c_endmsg;         // message sent when a component mode cell's value is finished changing
00129     t_symbol *c_rowcomponentmsg;// message sent to determine what kind of component should be created for each cell in a column
00130     t_symbol *c_custommenuset;  // message to set a menu (for a readonly or custompaint column)
00131     t_symbol *c_custommenuresult;   // message sent when an item is chosen from a custom menu
00132     char c_editable;            // can you edit the data in a cell in this column
00133     char c_selectable;          // can select the data in a cell in this column (possibly without being able to edit)
00134     char c_multiselectable;     // can you select more than one cell in this column
00135     char c_sortable;            // can you click on a column heading to sort the data
00136     long c_initiallysorted;     // if this is set to JCOLUMN_INITIALLYSORTED_FORWARDS the column is displayed with the sort triangle
00137     long c_maxtextlen;          // maximum text length: this is used to allocate a buffer to pass to gettext (but there is also a constant)
00138     long c_sortdirection;
00139     long c_component;           // enum of components (check box etc.)
00140     char c_canselect;           // can select entire column
00141     char c_cancut;              // can cut/clear entire column
00142     char c_cancopy;             // can copy entire column
00143     char c_cancutcells;         // can cut a single cell (assumes "editable" or "selectable") (probably won't be implemented)
00144     char c_cancopycells;        // can copy a single cell
00145     char c_canpastecells;       // can paste into a single cell
00146     char c_hideable;            // can the column be hidden
00147     char c_hidden;              // is the column hidden (set/get)
00148     char c_numeric;             // is the data numeric (i.e., is getcellvalue implemented)
00149     char c_draggable;           // can drag the column to rearrange it
00150     char c_casesensitive;       // use case sensitive sorting (applies only to default text sorting)
00151     void *c_reference;          // reference for the use of the client
00152     double c_indentspacing;     // amount of space (in pixels) for one indent level
00153     t_symbol *c_insertbefore;   // name of column before which this one should have been inserted (used only once)
00154     t_symbol *c_cellcluemsg;    // message to send requesting clue text for a cell
00155     t_symbol *c_celltextcolormsg;   // message to get the cell's text color
00156     t_symbol *c_celltextstylemsg;   // message to get the cell's style and alignment
00157 } t_jcolumn;
00158 
00159 // columns are stored in a hashtab and accessed by name
00160 
00161 typedef struct _jdataview
00162 {
00163     t_object d_obj;
00164     void *obex;
00165     t_linklist *d_components;   // list of DataViewComponents showing this dataview
00166     t_object *d_client;         // object that will be sent messages to get data to display
00167     t_hashtab *d_columns;       // columns -- point to t_jcolumn objects
00168     t_hashtab *d_id2columns;    // columns from column IDs
00169     t_linklist *d_colorder;     // current order of columns
00170     t_indexmap *d_rowmap;       // collection of rows (including number of rows)
00171     long d_numcols;             // number of columns
00172     double d_rowheight;         // fixed height of a row in pixels
00173     char d_autoheight;          // height determined by font
00174     char d_hierarchical;        // does it allow hierarchical disclosure (true / false) -- not implemented yet
00175     t_jrgba d_rowcolor1;        // odd row color (striped)
00176     t_jrgba d_rowcolor2;        // even row color
00177     t_jrgba d_selectcolor;      // color when rows are selected
00178     t_jrgba d_bordercolor;      // border color
00179     char d_bordercolorset;      // was border color set? if not, use JUCE default
00180     char d_canselectmultiple;   // multiple rows are selectable
00181     char d_cancopy;             // copy enabled
00182     char d_cancut;              // cut / clear enabled
00183     char d_canpaste;            // paste enabled
00184     char d_canrearrangerows;        // rows can be dragged to rearrange -- may not be implemented yet
00185     char d_canrearrangecolumns; // columns can be dragged to rearrange
00186     long d_viscount;            // number of visible views of this dataview
00187     long d_inset;               // inset for table inside containing component in pixels
00188     char d_autosizeright;       // right side autosizes when top-level component changes
00189     char d_autosizebottom;      // bottom autosizes when top-level component changes
00190     char d_dragenabled;         // enabled for dragging (as in drag and drop)
00191     t_symbol *d_fontname;       // font name
00192     double d_fontsize;          // font size
00193     t_symbol *d_colheadercluemsg;   // message to send requesting clue text for the column headers
00194     char d_autosizerightcolumn; // right column should stretch to remaining width of the dataview, regardless of column width
00195     char d_customselectcolor;       // send getcellcolor message to draw selected cell, don't use select color
00196     void *d_qelem;              // defer updating
00197     double d_colheaderheight;
00198     char d_drawgrid;
00199     long d_top_inset;           // vertical inset for row background (default 0)
00200     long d_bottom_inset;        // vertical inset for row background (default 0)
00201     long d_borderthickness;     // border line thickness default 0 for no border
00202     char d_keyfocusable;        // notify component to grab some keys
00203     char d_enabledeletekey;     // delete key will delete selected rows
00204     char d_usegradient;         // color rows with gradient between rowcolor1 (top) and rowcolor2 (bottom)
00205     char d_inchange;            // in change flag for inspector end-change protection system
00206     char d_horizscrollvisible;  // is horizontal scroll bar visible
00207     char d_vertscrollvisible;   // is vertical scroll bar visible
00208     char d_scrollvisset;        // has the scroll visibility ever been changed since the dv was created?
00209     char d_overridefocus;       // override default focus behavior where ListBox is focused when assigning focus to the dataview
00210     char d_usesystemfont;       // use system font (true by default)
00211     t_object *d_searchcolumn;   // column we ask for celltext in order to navigate the selection via the keyboard
00212     t_object *d_returnkeycolumn;// column that is sent the return key when a given row is selected
00213     void *d_navcache;           // sorted list of column strings for key navigation
00214     char d_usecharheight;       // use font specified in points rather than pixels (default is pixels)
00215 } t_jdataview;
00216 
00217 // used to notify a component of a jdataview change
00218 
00219 typedef struct _jdv_notifier
00220 {
00221     t_jdataview *n_dataview;
00222     t_symbol *n_what;
00223     void *n_data;
00224 } t_jdv_notifier;

00227 // used to pass data to a client sort function
00228 
00229 typedef struct _privatesortrec
00230 {
00231     t_jcolumn *p_col;       // column object to sort
00232     char p_fwd;             // 1 if sorting "forwards"
00233     t_object *p_client;
00234     t_jdataview *p_dv;
00235 } t_privatesortrec;

00436 // adding rows
00437 
00438 // a row reference is a way of distinguishing a row to the owning object. This is up to the object whose data is being displayed.
00439 // for example, it could be a pointer to an entry in a database
00440 // or if you are displaying attributes it could be a symbol
00441 
00442 typedef void *t_rowref;
00443 
00444 void jdataview_addrow(t_object *dv, t_rowref rr);
00445 void jdataview_addrows(t_object *dv, long count, t_rowref *rrs);
00446 void jdataview_deleterow(t_object *dv, t_rowref rr);
00447 void jdataview_deleterows(t_object *dv, long count, t_rowref *rrs);
00448 void jdataview_deleteselectedrows(t_object *dv); 
00449 void jdataview_clear(t_object *dv);
00450 int jdataview_getnumrows(t_object *dv);
00451 void jdataview_gettextinrows(t_object *dv, t_rowref *rows, char *cellsep, char **text);
00452 int jdataview_selectedrowcount(t_object *dv);
00453 t_rowref *jdataview_getallrows(t_object *dv);
00454 t_rowref *jdataview_getselectedrows(t_object *dv);
00455 void jdataview_applytoselectedrows(t_object *dv, t_symbol *msg, long bycell);
00456 
00457 void jdataview_enablerow(t_object *dv, t_rowref rr, long way);
00458 
00459 void jdataview_selectall(t_object *dv);
00460 void jdataview_selectnone(t_object *dv);

00525 
00526 // DataViewComponent calls this for a custom paint method for a column
00527 
00528 void jdataview_clientpaintcell(t_object *dv, t_symbol *msg, t_object *pv, int columnId, int rowNumber, int width, int height, int rowIsSelected);
00529 
00530 // custom paint method should be declared as:
00531 // void myobject_paint(t_myobject *x, t_object *patcherview, t_symbol *colname, t_rowref rr, int width, int height, int rowIsSelected)
00532 // to obtain the graphics context call patcherview_getjgraphics() on the patcherview arg
00533 // use jcolumn_setcustompaint to set the message symbol for this method for a column
00534 
00535 // the jdataview doesn't hold data. It just sends messages to an owning object to display it
00536 // the messages may be cached for speed. The first level interface just defines a textual
00537 // display. Eventually there will be a custom component for a row.
00538 
00539 // sorting: columns can be textual (c_numeric == 0) or numeric or they can define a custom sort
00540 // method by calling jcolumn_setcustomsort to a symbol. This symbol names a method that will be
00541 // called to sort the data for this column. It is of the form:
00542 // long myobject_sort(t_rowref a, t_rowref b) -- which will be passed two rowrefs. In addition,
00543 // custom sort clients need to implement the sortdata message, which is passed a pointer to
00544 // a t_privatesortrec. It needs to store this statically as it is sent before the custom sort message is
00545 // received.
00546 void jdataview_getcolumnmenuforcell(t_object *dv, t_symbol *colname, t_rowref rr, long *argc, t_atom **argv, char **enabled);
00547 void jdataview_cellcolumnmenuresult(t_object *dv, t_symbol *colname, t_rowref rr, long result);
00548 
00549 void jdataview_sortcolumn(t_object *x, t_symbol *colname, int fwd);
00550 void jdataview_sort(t_object *x, t_symbol *colname, int fwd);
00551 void jdataview_resort(t_object *x);
00552 long jdataview_getsortcolumn(t_object *x);
00553 
00554 // selection
00555 
00556 void jdataview_selectcell(t_object *dv, t_symbol *colname, t_rowref rr);
00557 void jdataview_selectrow(t_jdataview *x, t_rowref rr);
00558 void jdataview_selectcolumn(t_jdataview *x, t_symbol *colname);
00559 void jdataview_selectallrows(t_jdataview *x);
00560 
00561 long jdataview_iscellselected(t_jdataview *x, t_symbol *colname, t_rowref rr);
00562 long jdataview_isrowselected(t_jdataview *x, t_rowref rr);
00563 long jdataview_iscolumnselected(t_jdataview *x, t_symbol *colname);

00590 
00591 /*
00592 
00593 -- "columncreated": notification of a column being created
00594 
00595 void myobject_columncreated(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname);
00596 
00597 -- "rowadded" / "rowdeleted": notification of a row being added / deleted
00598 
00599 void myobject_rowadded(t_myobject *x, t_rowref rr);
00600 void myobject_rowdeleted(t_myobject *x, t_rowref rr);
00601 
00602 -- "sortstarted": notification of a sort starting (will get sort messages)
00603 
00604 void myobject_sortstarted(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname, long direction);
00605 
00606 -- "compare": sort the data according to column / direction, return 1 if r1 > r2, -1 if r2 > r1
00607 
00608 long myobject_compare(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname, long direction, t_rowref r1, t_rowref r2);
00609 
00610 -- "gettext": get string to show in a cell
00611 
00612 void myobject_gettext(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname, t_rowref rr, char *text);
00613 
00614 -- "editstarted": notification that editing is starting in a cell
00615 
00616 void myobject_editstarted(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname, t_rowref rr);
00617 
00618 -- "editentered": editing has finished and here is some new text for a cell
00619 
00620 void myobject_editenter(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname, t_rowref rr, char *newtext);
00621 
00622 // plus, a message specific to a button clicked in a cell (this allows for multiple buttons per column)
00623 
00624 void myobject_buttonmessage(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname, t_rowref rr, t_symbol *msg);
00625 
00626 // editing operations, "cutcell", "copycell", "pastecell", "clearcell"
00627 
00628 void myobject_cutcell(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname, t_rowref rr);
00629 void myobject_copycell(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname, t_rowref rr);
00630 void myobject_pastecell(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname, t_rowref rr);
00631 void myobject_clearcell(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname, t_rowref rr);
00632 
00633 // "cutcolumn", "copycolumn", "pastecolumn", "clearcolumn"
00634 
00635 void myobject_cutcolumn(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname);
00636 void myobject_copycolumn(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname);
00637 void myobject_pastecolumn(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname);
00638 void myobject_clearcolumn(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname);
00639 
00640 // "cutrow", "copyrow", "pasterow", "clearrow", "deleterow"
00641 
00642 void myobject_cutrow(t_myobject *x, t_rowref rr);
00643 void myobject_copyrow(t_myobject *x, t_rowref rr);
00644 void myobject_pasterow(t_myobject *x, t_rowref rr);
00645 void myobject_clearrow(t_myobject *x, t_rowref rr);
00646 void myobject_deleterow(t_myobject *x, t_rowref rr);
00647 
00648 // customization: an object can have a paintcell method instead of displaying text
00649 
00650 void myobject_paintcell(t_myobject *x, t_symbol *colname, t_rowref rr, void *ctx);
00651 
00652 // implementation notes:
00653 
00654 JUCE refreshComponentForCell needs to have the ability to create a custom component given a
00655 class name. How can that be done, with templates? 
00656 
00657 Yes you can use template argument passed to new, i.e.,
00658 
00659 template<class T>
00660 blah<T>::blah
00661 {
00662     foo (which could be a member of blah?) = new T;
00663 }
00664 
00665 */
00666 
00667 END_USING_C_LINKAGE
